name: Smartcuts
headline: Chrome extension to turn clicks & keystrokes into no-code automations
description: Smartcuts is a Chrome extension that lets you automate anything in your browser, without code. Record your clicks and keystrokes, and replay them later on similar web pages to automate repetitive work. It's like Excel macros for any website.

founders.name: Brian Noguchi, Founder
founders.description: Founder of Smartcuts (W21) and cofounder of Lever (S12).

generated_description:
**Smartcuts: Streamlining Automation Without Coding**

Founded in 2019 and a graduate of Y Combinator Batch W21, Smartcuts is a dynamic New York-based startup with a mission to simplify digital life through its innovative Chrome extension. The company operates with a lean team of three, under the guidance of Group Partner Brad Flora.

At its core, Smartcuts provides users with a no-code solution to automate browser interactions. Imagine being able to record your clicks and keystrokes as you work on any website and then replay those actions whenever needed. It’s designed for those everyday tasks that can feel tedious—like filling out forms, sending the same emails, or navigating through large datasets in Google Sheets. 

Think of Smartcuts as the Excel macros of the web: by automating repetitive tasks, it frees up your time and allows you to focus on what truly matters. It seamlessly integrates with a variety of popular sites and applications such as Google Sheets, Gmail, Slack, Trello, Facebook, and many more, making it incredibly versatile for personal and professional use.

The conversation around automation and no-code tools is surging, and Smartcuts is poised to empower users who may feel daunted by technical barriers. Their website, [trysmartcuts.com](https://trysmartcuts.com), invites users to request early access and experience the future of web automation.

In summary, Smartcuts is not just about automating tasks; it’s about transforming how we interact with the digital world—making technology more accessible to everyone. If you’re ready to take the plunge into automation without writing a single line of code, Smartcuts is ready to assist.
